election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1823 Governor

overview.note: John Andrew Shulze received 84,340 votes as J. Andrew Shulze, 4722 as John Andrew Shulze, 754 as John A. Shulze and 112 as Andrew Shulze.
Andrew Gregg received 53 votes as Andrew Gragg and 1 vote as Andrew Greg.

sub_unit.name: Beaver
sub_unit.note: While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Beaver County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Bucks
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 3073 votes and Andrew Gregg with 3083 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bensalem
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 118 votes and Andrew Gregg with 92 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bristol
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 115 votes and Andrew Gregg with 113 votes.

sub_unit.name: Falls
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 66 votes and Andrew Gregg with 152 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lower Makefield
sub_unit.note: The Democrat and Farmers' Gazette (Doylestown, PA) reversed the results for John Andrew Shulze and Andrew Gregg.

sub_unit.name: Middletown
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 100 votes.

sub_unit.name: New Britain
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 107 votes.

sub_unit.name: Newtown
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 134 votes.

sub_unit.name: Nockamixon
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 179 votes and Andrew Gregg with 46 votes.

sub_unit.name: Richland
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) reversed the results for John Andrew Shulze and Andrew Gregg.

sub_unit.name: Rockhill
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 210 votes and Andrew Gregg with 80 votes.

sub_unit.name: Tinicum
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 145 votes.

sub_unit.name: Upper Makefield
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 183 votes.

sub_unit.name: Wrightstown
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 75 votes.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: "Four districts to be heard from which are expected to give Mr. Shulze from two to three hundred majority." The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Bloom
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 46" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Brier Creek
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 37" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Castawissa
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 66" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Hemlock
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 90" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Liberty
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 133" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Mifflin
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 78" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Crawford
sub_unit.note: While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Crawford County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Carlisle
sub_unit.note: Three of the votes for John Andrew Shulze were listed for John Andrew Shulze (he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze in the ballot) and were not officially counted in the individual township totals in the Carlisle District, according to the American Volunteer of October 16, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Carlisle
sub_unit.note: "A very insignifficant (sic) majority indeed, on the part of Federalism and Greggism in the borough of Carlisle; when it is well known that they, with a certainty calculated upon forty or fifty majority. This augurs well in favour of Democracy and her candidate J. Andrew Shulze; because our political enemies exerted every nerve to get every member of their party to the poll; and the democrats can count about thirty of their party, who were engaged in their daily occupations and did not take time to give in their votes. On the general election-day we count upon twenty ought majority of J. ANDREW SHULZE in the borough-box. Democrats, be on your guard, and do your duty on that day, and we will conquer over Federalism in the county of Cumberland, with the handsome majority of at least SIX HUNDRED." Cumberland Metropolitan (Carlisle, PA). October 7, 1823.

"Perhaps at no former period was an election so warmly contested in this borough as that on Tuesday last. Both parties fully exerted themselves - and although deception was practised by some of the friends of Gregg, by a distribution of spurious tickets, the result is as favourable as we expected." American Volunteer (Carlisle, PA). October 16, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Lower Paxton
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) lists Lower Paxton as Planks.

sub_unit.name: Lykens
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) lists Lykens as Gratztown.

sub_unit.name: Upper Paxton
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) lists Upper Paxton as Millersburg.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 173 votes.

sub_unit.name: Darby
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 194 votes and Andrew Gregg with 283 votes.

sub_unit.name: Erie
sub_unit.note: While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Erie County as John A. Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Union and Concord
sub_unit.note: "By referring to the official return of the election in this county, contained in to-day's paper, it will be perceived that the above district did not elect. The reasons we are informed, are these: after six or seven votes had been handed in, the judges were told that they had taken an illegal vote; and that it was useless to take any more." Erie Gazette (Erie, PA). October 23, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 463 votes.

sub_unit.name: Indiana
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John A. Shulze with 977 votes and Andrew Gregg with 304 votes.
While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Indiana County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John A. Shulze with 299 votes and Andrew Gregg with 82 votes.
While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Jefferson County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Lancaster
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 1016 votes and Andrew Gregg with 1156 votes.

sub_unit.name: East
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 230 votes and Andrew Gregg with 274 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lampeter
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 250 votes.

sub_unit.name: Manor
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 138 votes.

sub_unit.name: West
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 291 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lycoming
sub_unit.note: "Two districts not heard from, which will give Mr. Shulze from 60 to 100 majority." The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Big Island
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 84" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Jersey Shore
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 127" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Williamsport
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 51" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Mercer
sub_unit.note: "This has been the largest election ever known in this part of the county. There has been 550 votes given in the town district." American Sentinel and Mercantile Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). October 22, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Hatborough
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette lists John Andrew Shulze with 207 votes and Andrew Gregg with 279 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pottsgrove
sub_unit.note: The Official Returns listed in the Norristown Herald and Weekly Advertiser (Norristown, PA) list the borough of Pottstown together with the township of Pottsgrove.

sub_unit.name: Whitemarsh
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette lists John Andrew Shulze with 382 votes and Andrew Gregg with 260 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bethlehem
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists Andrew Gregg with 73 votes.

sub_unit.name: Easton
sub_unit.note: The Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) lists John Andrew Shulze with 577 votes.

sub_unit.name: Chillisquaque
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 46" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 12" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Lower Mahoney
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 50" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Milton
sub_unit.note: "A tie." The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Point
sub_unit.note: "I have just heard from Point township - Shulze's majority is 23." The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 18, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Rush
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 105" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Turbit
sub_unit.note: "Majority for Shulze - 245" The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Upper Mahonoy
sub_unit.note: "Upper Mahonoy not heard from but will give Mr. Shulze 50 majority." The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA). October 20, 1823.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette, Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) and The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) list 2326 votes for John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: North
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette, Franklin Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) and The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) list 220 votes for John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Blockley
sub_unit.note: Includes Kingsessing.

sub_unit.name: Kingsessing
sub_unit.note: Included in Blockley.

sub_unit.name: Ward 5
sub_unit.note: The United States Gazette lists John Andrew Shulze with 332 votes and Andrew Gregg with 246 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pike
sub_unit.note: While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Pike County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Schuylkill
sub_unit.note: John Andrew Shulze received 112 votes as Andrew Shulze.
Andrew Gregg received 53 votes as Andrew Gragg.

The Chronicle of the Times lists John Andrew Shulze with 855 votes and Andrew Gregg with 800 votes, but these are either addition or typesetting errors as the township totals add up to the correct vote totals.

sub_unit.name: Union
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo Valley list John Andrew Shulze with 1765 votes and Andrew Gregg with 1103 votes.

sub_unit.name: Venango
sub_unit.note: While in most of the state he was listed as J. Andrew Shulze, he received his votes in Venango County as John Andrew Shulze.

sub_unit.name: Wayne
sub_unit.note: Andrew Gregg received 1 vote as Andrew Greg.
John Glosander received 3 votes as Captain Glosander.

sub_unit.name: Youngstown
sub_unit.note: The Westmoreland Republican (Greensburgh, PA) lists Youngstown as the Unity District.

sub_unit.name: York
sub_unit.note: Borough of York and townships of York, Hellam, Spring Garden, Manchester, West Manchester and Conewago.
